intro: Sebaea khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi sebaea, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stem and ovate, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
